a.span: Meal Pick-up Available Starting Monday, March 23rd (Click for details)

span.span: Click for symptoms of COVID-19, a cold, the flu and seasonal allergies

hr.p: The health and wellness of our students, staff, and community are very important to us and we will continue to monitor this situation and provide information as it becomes available.
The district has preparedness and response plans which give guidance on how to manage such incidents within the K-12 school environment.
At this time, the same advice for preventing the flu applies to preventing the coronavirus, including:

ul.li: If you are sick, please stay home to prevent the spread of disease
Wash your hands frequently, for at least 20 seconds with soap
Ensure that ill students are kept away from other students and are sent home as soon as possible
If you have a fever, shortness of breath or other symptoms that could be related to COVID-10 Contact a doctor and call the local health department at 316-321-3400.

hr.p: The school district receives regular communication from the State Department of Education on this matter and will modify our practices accordingly. USD 402 has plans in place for potential pandemic crisis situations such as COVID-19 and the district is following the interim guidance provided by the state.
USD 402 has multiple hospital-grade disinfectant germ foggers which have been used after hours in our schools and buildings- these foggers are helpful in reducing repeat illness.

p.strong: Please refer to the following resources from health officials on the matter as they are expected to be updated regularly:

p.b: Regular KDHE updates can be found here

a.span: Kansas Department of Health and Environment (KDHE) COVID-19 Resources

div.center: Augusta Public Schools USD 402 | 2345 Greyhound Drive Augusta, Kansas 67010 | Phone 316.775.5484 | Fax 316.775.5035

center.p:
NOTICE OF NON-DISCRIMINATION
Augusta USD 402 does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, or disability in admission, access to, or treatment in its programs and activities. Any persons having inquiries concerning USD 402's compliance with regulations implementing Title VI and Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972, Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, and the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, may contact the Superintendent of Schools, 2345 Greyhound Drive, Augusta, Kansas, (316-775-5484), who has been designated to coordinate the district's efforts to comply with these laws. All offers of employment are dependent on approval by the USD 402 Board of Education.
